Question: Upload multiform data: :HeloI tryed to upload some data to my webserver.whit curl works finecurl -s -uedoweb-admin:admin -F"data=@/home/raul/test/t1/6376990.pdf;type=application/pdf" -XPUT api.localhost/resource/frl:6376979/dataand here the tracehttp://pastebin.com/jJmungAyhere the new methode.        URL myurl;    HttpURLConnection conn;    String port = "9000";    String user = "edoweb-admin";    String password = "admin";    String encoding = Base64.encodeBase64String((user + ":" + password).getBytes());    String boundary = "==" + System.currentTimeMillis() + "===";    String crlf = "\r\n";    String twoHyphens = "--";    String attachmentName = "data";    String attachmentFileName = "6376986.pdf";    DataOutputStream request;    try {        myurl = new URL("http://localhost:9000/resource/frl:6376984/data");        conn = (HttpURLConnection) myurl.openConnection();        conn.setDoOutput(true);        conn.setRequestMethod("PUT");        conn.setRequestProperty("Content-Type", "multipart/form-data;boundary=" + boundary);        conn.setRequestProperty("Accept", "*/*");    } catch (Exception e) {        throw new RuntimeException(e);    }    try {        request = new DataOutputStream(conn.getOutputStream());        request.writeBytes(twoHyphens + boundary + crlf);        request.writeBytes("Content-Disposition: form-data; name=\"" + attachmentName + "\";filename=\""                + attachmentFileName + "\"" + crlf);        request.writeBytes("Content-Type: application/pdf");        request.writeBytes(crlf);        System.out.println(conn.getResponseCode());    } catch (Exception e) {        throw new RuntimeException(e);    }I found some issues in my code and as well on the webserver. I wrote a new methode and now the server response 400.can anyone help me?
Please using this api: String.getBytes.
Answer: The 400 status code means that the server could not understand the request due to invalid syntax. In your case, it seems like the server expects a different format for the data field in the multipart form data.

The server might expect the data field to be in the format:
```
data=@/home/raul/test/t1/6376990.pdf;type=application/pdf
```

In your code, you are trying to send the data field as a file, which is not the correct format. You should send the file as a part of the multipart form data, not as a separate field.

Here is how you can modify your code to send the file as a part of the multipart form data:

```java
String boundary = "==" + System.currentTimeMillis() + "===";
String crlf = "\r\n";
String twoHyphens = "--";
String attachmentName = "data";
String attachmentFileName = "6376986.pdf";

try {
    URL url = new URL("http://localhost:9000/resource/frl:6376984/data");
    HttpURLConnection conn = (HttpURLConnection) url.openConnection();
    conn.setDoOutput(true);
    conn.setRequestMethod("PUT");
    conn.setRequestProperty("Content-Type", "multipart/form-data;boundary=" + boundary);
    conn.setRequestProperty("Accept", "*/*");

    DataOutputStream request = new DataOutputStream(conn.getOutputStream());
    request.writeBytes(twoHyphens + boundary + crlf);
    request.writeBytes("Content-Disposition: form-data; name=\"" + attachmentName + "\";filename=\"" + attachmentFileName + "\"" + crlf);
    request.writeBytes("Content-Type: application/pdf" + crlf);
    request.writeBytes(crlf);

    FileInputStream fileInputStream = new FileInputStream("/home/raul/test/t1/6376990.pdf");
    byte[] buffer = new byte[4096];
    int bytesRead;
    while ((bytesRead = fileInputStream.read(buffer)) != -1) {
        request.write(buffer, 0, bytesRead);
    }
    request.writeBytes(crlf);
    request.writeBytes(twoHyphens + boundary + twoHyphens + crlf);
    request.flush();
    request.close();

    int responseCode = conn.getResponseCode();
    System.out.println("Response Code: " + responseCode);
} catch (Exception e) {
    throw new RuntimeException(e);
}
```

This code reads the file and sends it as a part of the multipart form data. The server should be able to understand and process this correctly.

Please replace the file path and other parameters as per your requirements.

Also, make sure to handle the exceptions properly in your production code. This is just a basic example to help you get started.
